intro: Octomeria spannagelii, commonly known as the mountain nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it has a woody stem that becomes more branched with age. Octomeria spannagelii is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in Andean regions.
